page.title: 08INSH MARSHES - 1
page.content:
{Insh Marshes}are situated in the flood plain of the{River Spey}and are the largest marshes outside Anglia. In 1973, thanks to the Cadbury family, {The Royal Society for the Protection {of Birds}(R.S.P.B.) were able to purchase 564 acres of marsh and woodland and with subsequent leasing from sympathetic landowners now manage an area of{1215 acres.
At the south east corner two hides have been built along with a visitor reception centre which welcomed some {2000 visitors}in the summer of 1985. The marshes are particularly well suited as a reserve for many reasons. The vegetation suits the needs of birdlife; the{aquatic vegetation}is very nutritious and{rare plants}such as the least yellow water lily are plentiful.{Birds of prey}are numerous.
